Quest 1: Endure a day of necessary but draining bureaucracy in government offices, where your identity is reduced to flawed forms and subject to the uninformed judgment of officials.

Task Description: You pull on the male conductor's uniform. It fits poorly, erasing your shape. It makes you look "decent" and masculine.
Source Experience: Wear the uniform same way every other conductor friend of yours wears.
Choice Rank 1 (Most Acceptable): Carry a small jasmine garland (gazra/malipu) in your pocket instead of directly decorating yourself with it.
Choice Rank 2: Alter your shirt to fit in a little more feminine way, claiming "it shrank in the wash" if asked.
Choice Rank 3: N/A

Task Description: Before the shift, drivers and conductors gather at a chai stall. They casually tease you about the way you walk.
Source Experience: Laugh it off since it was meant as a joke only.
Choice Rank 1 (Most Acceptable): Drink your chai in silence, ignoring the conversation until the bus is ready.
Choice Rank 2: Leave the group to sit alone on the bus, isolating yourself further.
Choice Rank 3: Jokingly embrace it and comment back "Hey, I walk with grace".

Task Description: In between stops, you are tired and lean against the rail near the ladies' seats. A female passenger says, "This is for ladies, why are you standing so close? Go to the mens side!"
Source Experience: Move instantly to the crowded mens area to avoid making any women uncomfortable.
Choice Rank 1 (Most Acceptable): Defend yourself by saying "Madam, I am just doing my job, the bus is full."
Choice Rank 2: Ignore her and stand your ground but turn your back to her
Choice Rank 3: Immediate Pen Attack (CHA): Grab the pen and firmly circle 'O', demanding immediate recognition.
Choice Rank 4 (Least Acceptable): N/A

Task Description: During peak hour, the bus is really cramped. You push past people to sit at your assigned seat feeling uncomfortable with how aware you are of your body.
Source Experience: Maneuver your heavy ticket bag to cover yourself like a shield.
Choice Rank 1 (Most Acceptable): Say "Move inside! Don't crowd the door!" hoping to make some space for yourself.
Choice Rank 2: Try to endure it until the next stop, but accidentally end up hitting a passenger.
Choice Rank 3: Retreat and Restart (DEX): Pull the application and commit to returning another day when a different official is present.

Task Description: You were late for lunch break and overhear other conductors share food and whispering about how weird you talk and act.
Source Experience: Finish food quickly and return to the safety of the empty bus.
Choice Rank 1 (Most Acceptable): Ignore their comments pretending you don't hear so you don't have to eat alone.
Choice Rank 2: Confront them and ask, "Do you have a problem with it? How is it affecting you?".
Choice Rank 3: Staff Change (CHA): Politely state that the official's lack of training is concerning and request to be served by someone else.

Task Description: You complain to your friend about your coworkers . He sighs, "Look, you are a man. Be tough. If you act soft, people will take advantage. Adjust a little."
Source Experience: Agree silently, knowing nothing you do will matter.
Choice Rank 1 (Most Acceptable): Try to talk to your deputy manager to change your route to a less crowded one. (Locked path. this path, when hovered on will show the locked path overlays and will not be selectable)
Choice Rank 2: Fake sickness to get a few days off immediately.
Choice Rank 3: The Stare Down (CON): Deliberately look at the reflection, forcing yourself to process the image and move on.
Choice Rank 4 (Least Acceptable): N/A

Task Description: After years of this cycle, the emotional and physical toll becomes unbearable. You must decide whether to quit. You have no savings, no degree. Just the knowledge that you cannot step on that bus again.
Source Experience: Resign citing "severe back pain" to leave on good terms.
Choice Rank 1 (Most Acceptable): Slowly, don't show up. Just go on your own new path now.
Choice Rank 2: "I cannot work in this environment." (Manager will likely mock you).
Choice Rank 3: Ask for a transfer you to a less crowded, safer route/time slot or not so public role which you know they won't give.

Task Description: With no higher education, the job search is limited. The few positions available require uncomfortable binary uniforms.
Source Experience: Take the job offered, accepting the compromise for stability.
Choice Rank 1 (Most Acceptable): Try to negotiate a gender neutral uniform or dress code exception.
Choice Rank 2: Refuse all jobs requiring a uniform, narrowing options to almost zero.
Choice Rank 3: Keep looking for a better opportunity.
Choice Rank 4 (Least Acceptable): N/A

Task Description: You meet some other trans women who share your loss and experiences. Joining your new friend on the street, you realise that everyone is clapping and exaggerating to get people to recognise them as trans and give them money. This feels a little odd and forced to you.
Source Experience: Clap quietly, hoping the saree does the work.
Choice Rank 1 (Most Acceptable): Mimic the others perfectly, adopting the loud clap and blessing gestures for survival.
Choice Rank 3: N/A
Choice Rank 4 (Least Acceptable): N/A

Quest 2: Survive the professional and financial collapse caused by workplace discrimination, forcing brutal choices between dignity, safety, and economic subsistence.

Task Description: The Corporate Binary: The mandatory male/female uniform memo arrives. Your preferred presentation clashes with the gender of the assigned uniform.
Choice Rank 1 (Most Acceptable): Wear Assigned Uniform (WIS): Wear the assigned uniform, sacrificing C/I for job security.
Choice Rank 2: Request Neutral Wear (CHA): Politely request a neutral uniform (e.g., plain trousers and shirt).
Choice Rank 3: Modify Uniform (INT): Subtly tailor the assigned uniform for your gender (Cost/Skill check).
Choice Rank 4 (Least Acceptable): Wear Preferred Dress (CHA): Wear your preferred dress instead of the uniform (High risk of termination).

Task Description: The Manager's Glare: Your manager calls you in, focusing only on your appearance and the "distraction" it's causing, not your performance metrics.
Choice Rank 1 (Most Acceptable): Apologize/Commit to Conformity (CHA): Promise to strictly adhere to the dress code immediately.
Choice Rank 2: Cite Company Policy (INT): Calmly cite the company's anti-discrimination policy.
Choice Rank 3: Defend Identity (CHA): Firmly state that your appearance does not affect your work.
Choice Rank 4 (Least Acceptable): Record the Meeting (DEX): Surreptitiously record the conversation for future evidence.

Task Description: The Water Cooler Whisper: You overhear colleagues making jokes about your clothing and using the wrong name/pronouns, leading to severe social isolation.
Choice Rank 1 (Most Acceptable): Maintain Professional Distance (WIS): Completely ignore the group and focus on work.
Choice Rank 2: Eat Lunch Alone (DEX): Skip the common area entirely to avoid interaction.
Choice Rank 3: Report to HR (INT): Document and submit a formal complaint to HR.
Choice Rank 4 (Least Acceptable): Direct Confrontation (CHA): Walk up and demand they stop the inappropriate talk.

Task Description: The Review Bias: Your performance review mentions "issues with fitting into the team culture" and "professional presentation," despite good work.
Choice Rank 1 (Most Acceptable): Sign and Accept (WIS): Sign the form to avoid conflict.
Choice Rank 2: Write a Rebuttal (INT): Add a written note contesting the subjective feedback.
Choice Rank 3: Refuse to Sign (CHA): Politely refuse to sign until the footnote is removed.
Choice Rank 4 (Least Acceptable): Look for a New Job (DEX): Immediately start applying to other companies.

Task Description: The Final Warning: The manager delivers a thinly veiled threat: "Change your look, or we'll be forced to let you go."
Choice Rank 1 (Most Acceptable): Conform Temporarily (WIS): Agree to conform for two weeks while searching for another job.
Choice Rank 2: Resign Immediately (DEX): Quit to save face and seek immediate unemployment benefits.
Choice Rank 3: Demand a Formal Explanation (INT): Force them to put the discrimination reason in writing.
Choice Rank 4 (Least Acceptable): Call a Lawyer (CHA): State you are immediately contacting legal counsel.

Task Description: The Firing: You are fired. The reason cited is "restructuring." You know it's discrimination.
Choice Rank 1 (Most Acceptable): Accept Severance (WIS): Take the severance pay (if offered) to ensure a short-term buffer.
Choice Rank 2: Walk Away (DEX): Leave the office immediately and process the trauma privately.
Choice Rank 3: Refuse to Leave (CHA): State you won't leave until the termination reason is corrected.
Choice Rank 4 (Least Acceptable): Initiate Legal Action (INT): File an immediate legal complaint with evidence.

Task Description: The Empty Pockets: Weeks later, savings are almost gone. You face a choice between survival through informal work or deeper precarity.
Choice Rank 1 (Most Acceptable): Sell Valuables (WIS): Sell cherished personal items (C/I loss, financial gain).
Choice Rank 2: Borrow from Family (CHA): Call a distant family member for a high-interest loan.
Choice Rank 3: Seek Street Work (DEX): Commit to low-wage, informal street work for immediate cash.
Choice Rank 4 (Least Acceptable): Apply to NGOs (INT): Spend time applying for non-profit/community-based jobs (long wait).
Privilege Marker (If Applicable): Ranks 2 & 4 (Borrow from Family, Apply to NGOs)

Task Description: The Performance Shift: To maximize street income, you consider adopting the performative, exaggerated mannerisms associated with trans people who beg.
Choice Rank 1 (Most Acceptable): Authentic Presentation (CHA): Beg quietly, presenting yourself authentically (Lower immediate income).
Choice Rank 2: Hide Identity (WIS): Wear clothes and hide makeup to appear cisgender while begging.
Choice Rank 3: Seek a Group (INT): Spend the day searching for other trans people who beg to join their network.
Choice Rank 4 (Least Acceptable): The Survival Act (DEX): Adopt the stereotypical, performative acts (Clapping/Singing).

Task Description: Finding the Peer: While working the street, you encounter another trans person who offers a potential bond and support.
Choice Rank 1 (Most Acceptable): Ignore and Work (WIS): Focus purely on the task of earning money, ignoring the social opportunity.
Choice Rank 2: Keep Distance (DEX): Maintain professional distance to avoid competition or conflict.
Choice Rank 3: Ask for Guidance (INT): Politely ask for advice on the best/safest spots to work.
Choice Rank 4 (Least Acceptable): Share Resources (CHA): Offer to share your food or water immediately to build trust.

Task Description: The Stare of Pity: A well-dressed cis person stops, staring with obvious pity, then drops a few coins into your hand without making eye contact.
Choice Rank 1 (Most Acceptable): Silent Gratitude (WIS): Quietly nod and accept the money, prioritizing the financial gain.
Choice Rank 2: Smile and Wave (DEX): Give them a wide, cheerful smile, disrupting their expectation of tragedy.
Choice Rank 3: Question of Intention (INT): Ask them, "What exactly are you pitying?" forcing them to articulate their discomfort.
Choice Rank 4 (Least Acceptable): Retort of Dignity (CHA): Look them in the eye and say, "I am working, not a spectacle," refusing the money.

Task Description: Harassment Risk: A group of young men loudly mocks your clothing and presentation from a passing vehicle. Your new friend is next to you.
Choice Rank 1 (Most Acceptable): Immediate Retreat (DEX): Both you and your friend quickly move into a side alley until they pass.
Choice Rank 2: Ignore, Focus on Work (CON): Continue your work, using sheer force of will to ignore the danger.
Choice Rank 3: Seek Nearby Authority (INT): Quickly flag down a nearby police officer or shop owner.
Choice Rank 4 (Least Acceptable): Shared Confrontation (CHA): Stand shoulder-to-shoulder with your friend and shout back a defiant response.

Task Description: The Next Step: You now have a small support network and a few days' wages. You must decide on a long-term plan.
Choice Rank 1 (Most Acceptable): Formalize Begging Route (WIS): Accept the current situation and focus on establishing a safer, more profitable street route.
Choice Rank 2: Seek Legal Aid (CHA): Use community connections to find pro-bono legal counsel to fight the firing.
Choice Rank 3: Enroll in Skill Training (INT): Use the money to register for a local skill training program.
Choice Rank 4 (Least Acceptable): Move Cities (DEX): Pool resources with your friend and travel to a more accepting city like Mumbai.
Privilege Marker (If Applicable): Ranks 2, 3, & 4 (Seek Legal Aid, Enroll in Skill Training, Move Cities)

Quest 3:Navigate a seemingly relaxed birthday gathering where every social interaction risks painful misrecognition, forcing you to prioritize either personal comfort or social harmony.

Task Description: The Unwanted Glimpse: The cab window reveals a reflection—a sudden, sickening reminder of the physical traits you constantly try to forget or hide.
Choice Rank 1 (Most Acceptable): Mental Wall (WIS): Focus mind away from the image.
Choice Rank 2: Breathe and Bear It (WIS): Acknowledge and endure the feeling.
Choice Rank 3: Digital Dive (INT): Plunge immediately into phone for distraction.
Choice Rank 4 (Least Acceptable): The Quick Fix (CHA): Smooth clothing aggressively to visually correct the 'fault'.

Task Description: The Betrayal of Sound: A friend introduces you, but the wrong pronoun slices through the air—a subtle, painful failure of recognition.
Choice Rank 1 (Most Acceptable): Silent Capitulation (WIS): Swallow the hurt, let the misgendering stand.
Choice Rank 2: The Delayed Pull-Aside (DEX): Gently pull friend aside later for a low-volume reminder.
Choice Rank 3: Self-Correction Affirmation (CHA): Introduce yourself with correct pronouns loudly afterward.
Choice Rank 4 (Least Acceptable): Immediate Retort (CHA): Cut friend off mid-sentence, correcting them sharply.

Task Description: The Weight of Observation: You feel the invisible weight of too many lingering eyes studying your outfit, mannerisms, and face.
Choice Rank 1 (Most Acceptable): Head Down, Shoulders In (DEX): Shrink your presence, focusing on the floor.
Choice Rank 2: The Prop of Normalcy (DEX): Raise your phone, pretending to receive a vital text.
Choice Rank 3: Proximity Shield (CHA): Grab a friend's arm, initiating a loud, distracting conversation.
Choice Rank 4 (Least Acceptable): The Dominant Gaze (CHA/Intimidation): Lock eyes with the starer until they look away.

Task Description: The Repetitive Sting: Your friend, distracted, uses the incorrect pronoun again. The failure feels like careless choice, reigniting the pain.
Choice Rank 1 (Most Acceptable): Emotional Retreat (WIS): Force a strained nod, signal non-verbally that it's okay.
Choice Rank 2: Silent Judgment (WIS/Intimidation): Give a long, silent look of disappointment.
Choice Rank 3: The Gentle Poke (CHA): Lean in and murmur, "Hey, remember the correct pronoun?"
Choice Rank 4 (Least Acceptable): Emergency Exit (DEX): Claim an urgent need and abruptly leave the interaction.

Task Description: The Inevitable Choice: Physical discomfort demands a break, but the host's gendered bathrooms present a high-stakes, obstacle course.
Choice Rank 1 (Most Acceptable): The Internal Holdout (CON): Commit to waiting until the party ends.
Choice Rank 2: The Cis Delegation (CHA): Ask the host directly, "Which bathroom would be best for me?"
Choice Rank 3: The Non-Gendered Escape (DEX): Aim immediately for the separate, single-stall powder room.
Choice Rank 4 (Least Acceptable): The Confident Entry (CHA): Choose the room aligning with your gender, stepping in firmly.

Task Description: The Question of Permission: A new acquaintance asks a personal, probing question about your medical/transition history—a clear overstep of boundaries.
Choice Rank 1 (Most Acceptable): The Simple Avoidance (WIS): Give a vague, non-committal, cis-palatable answer.
Choice Rank 2: The Witty Smoke Screen (CHA): Deliver a sharp joke to shift focus and make the group laugh.
Choice Rank 3: The Brick Wall (CHA): Lock eyes and state, in a low, firm voice, "That is private information."
Choice Rank 4 (Least Acceptable): The Public Lecture (INT): Launch into a concise, articulate explanation of transition diversity.

Task Description: The Cage of Expectation: A relative projects a narrow, stereotypical image onto you, suggesting your authentic self isn't "trans enough."
Choice Rank 1 (Most Acceptable): The Exaggerated Role (CHA): Force yourself to adopt a louder, more animated personality closer to their expectation.
Choice Rank 2: Quiet Defiance (WIS): Smile thinly, nod, and immediately steer the conversation to a dull topic.
Choice Rank 3: The Diversity Thesis (INT): Calmly explain that trans identities are a spectrum, not media tropes.
Choice Rank 4 (Least Acceptable): The Reversal (CHA): Tilt your head and ask, "Why does it matter what I look like for you to believe me?"

Task Description: The Weight of Labor: The exhaustion of repeated corrections culminates in a piercing stab of self-doubt: are you being "too much?"
Choice Rank 1 (Most Acceptable): Internal Rally (WIS): Mentally repeat a mantra: "My identity is valid." (Comfort Check DC 10).
Choice Rank 2: Overcompensation Loop (CHA): Resolve to be overly warm and polite to "make up" for the corrections.
Choice Rank 3: Physical Retreat (DEX): Excuse yourself and retreat to a quiet, dimly lit area for five minutes.
Choice Rank 4 (Least Acceptable): Textual Lifeline (CHA): Immediately text a trusted queer friend for rapid, affirming reply.

Task Description: The Medical Boundary Breach: A close friend casually asks about invasive, deeply personal medical plans.
Choice Rank 1 (Most Acceptable): The Ignored Query (CHA): Pretend they asked about the weather, immediately asking them a question about their travels.
Choice Rank 2: The Personal Explanation (INT): Briefly explain that transition is personal and not all seek surgery.
Choice Rank 3: The Firm Line (INT): State clearly, "My medical history is private. Let's talk about [safe topic]."
Choice Rank 4 (Least Acceptable): The Retaliatory Inquiry (CHA/Intimidation): Loudly ask them a personal question about their medical history.

Task Description: The Threat of the Alley: Walking alone, a group of idling men fall silent and turn their full, assessing attention on you. Whispers and low laughter follow.
Choice Rank 1 (Most Acceptable): Swift Acceleration (DEX): Tighten grip on your bag and rapidly increase pace, eyes fixed ahead.
Choice Rank 2: Sanctuary Dive (DEX): Quickly dart into the nearest open shop to wait out the confrontation.
Choice Rank 3: The Audible Connection (CHA): Pull out your phone and loudly begin a conversation with a fictional friend.
Choice Rank 4 (Least Acceptable): The Unflinching Stride (CON): Maintain normal pace, refusing to acknowledge the intimidation.

Task Description: The Casual Erasure: The auto driver uses the wrong gendered term while confirming the drop-off, a jarring moment of misrecognition from a stranger.
Choice Rank 1 (Most Acceptable): The Silent Acceptance (DEX): Simply nod, pay the fare, and rush away.
Choice Rank 2: Name-Based Confirmation (WIS): Reconfirm the location using only your name (if gender-neutral) instead of correcting the honorific.
Choice Rank 3: The Quick Correction (CHA): Hand the money over and state clearly: "And for future reference, it's [correct honorific]."
Choice Rank 4 (Least Acceptable): The "Tip for Respect" (CHA): Over-tip the driver significantly, hoping to "buy" respect.

Task Description: The Host's Last Error: The kind host bids you farewell but misgenders you one final time—a sour note to end an emotionally draining evening.
Choice Rank 1 (Most Acceptable): Emotional Surrender (WIS): Let the mistake slide, prioritizing your immediate departure.
Choice Rank 2: The Ghosting Exit (DEX): Skip the formal goodbye, waving vaguely from the path.
Choice Rank 3: The Digital Reminder (INT): Wait until outside, then send a quick, gentle correction via text.
Choice Rank 4 (Least Acceptable): The Affectionate Correction (CHA): Give a final hug and whisper: "Love you, but it's [pronoun]!"
